title: Where to buy unique Eagles Super Bowl LIX clothing , merch , and gear
body_text:
16 shops to buy Eagles Super Bowl merch in Philadelphia
Buy Eagles Super Bowl merch and clothing from these local shops in Philadelphia.
After a dominant 55-23 victory over the Washington Commanders in the NFC Championship, the Eagles are headed to the Super Bowl.
Itâ€™s a magical time in Philadelphia. After Sundayâ€™s win, fans flooded Broad Street, families banged pots and pans on their doorsteps, and a wave of Kelly green-clad supporters roamed the city in celebration.
Super Bowl LIX kicks off Sunday, Feb. 9, at 6:30 p.m., and like starting quarterback Jalen Hurts said before the NFC Championship: â€œItâ€™s going to take the whole stadium, the whole cityâ€ to bring home the win.
If youâ€™re looking to join the sea of green, here are the best local shops and designers selling Eagles merch for Super Bowl LIX.
One of Phillyâ€™s leading sportswear designers, Jay Pross already has new NFC Championship tees ready to go in addition to unique pieces like the Zach Baun â€œBald Eagleâ€ hoodies, Saquon Barkley â€œTake Flightâ€ hoodies, Big Dom â€œThe DOMfatherâ€ hoodies, and more.

Philadelphia schoolteacher Jen Basile started designing and hand-dying graphic tees in the basement of her South Philly home in 2020. Five years later, the brand is booming with a wide range of Philly sports merch, from fuzzy sherpa zip-ups to throwback Eagles jackets and classic graphic tees.
ğŸŒ blessedindistress.com, ğŸ“· @blessed_in_distress_apparel_
Dhwani Saraiya is slowly becoming Philadelphiaâ€™s favorite sportswear designer, having already gone viral with her designs and painted a Phillies mural at Citizens Bank Park. Check out the â€œSmoke â€˜Emâ€ collection featuring Jalen Hurts' celebratory cigar toke after the NFC Championship or â€œPhiladelphia Football Book Clubâ€ hoodies inspired by A.J. Brownâ€™s sideline book reading.

These hand-dyed graphic tees, hoodies, and stadium-approved transparent handbags add flare and cuteness to Eagles game day. Comb through dozens of clothing items in Kelly greens and retro styles, including various beanies or caps.
ğŸŒ dyehardfan.com, ğŸ“· @dyehardfan
Longtime Philly sportswear brand Dye Hard Philly finally got some of its merch into the hands of an Eagle: Dallas Goedert. The brandâ€™s style is cemented in the gridiron toughness of Philadelphia.
ğŸŒ teepublic.com/user/dyehardphilly, ğŸ“· @dyehardphilly
Stephanie Harveyâ€™s printing and design business has been supplying the region with charmingly delightful clothing, merch, and gifts since 2007. Exit 343 Designâ€™s â€œBird Gangâ€ and â€œBrotherly Shoveâ€ tees are among the great options while Philly is on the hunt for a Super Bowl win.

Hog Island Press' forte is Phillies gear for a good cause, most notably collaborating with Phillies legend and former head coach Charlie Manuel to raise money for local charities. The company, though, gets you ready for game days with its sweet heather green â€œBird Gangâ€ shirt.

Phillyâ€™s flagship premium and authentic sportswear store has quality longsleeve fleeces, hoodies, and sweatshirts. Stop by in-store and find even rarer pieces on sale.
ğŸŒ mitchellandness.com,ğŸ“1306 Walnut St., Philadelphia, Pa. 19107, ğŸ“ 267-273-7622, ğŸ“· @mnessflagshipstore
Julia Swahlâ€™s custom-embroidered clothing exudes understated classiness, with clean designs, quality materials, and sports merch that values style over being punchy. Be on the lookout for an Eagles-inspired Super Bowl watch party basket giveaway on Instagram.

Parl Carpenterâ€™s eclectic and unique hand-drawn designs, often weaving Philly iconography into larger symbols like an Eagle made up of the city skyline, transfer effortlessly onto quality graphic tees.

Philly Drinkers is overflowing with funny and irreverent graphic clothing, from tees to hoodies. Its Super Bowl LIX gear includes an â€œItâ€™s Always Super in Philadelphiaâ€ shirt.

Phillygoat has one of the largest collections of Philly sports merch in the city. Its flying Saquon shirt and â€œE-L-G-S-E-Sâ€ shirt, a nod to Mayor Cherelle L. Parkerâ€™s spelling blunder before the NFC Championship, are must-buys.

Veterans Shirtium is going all out for its love of Jalen Hurts and Saquon Barkley, so much so that the Hurtsâ€™ NFC Champs tee and Barkleyâ€™s flying jump hoodies are signature styles this year. R.I.P. Veterans Stadium, gone but not forgotten.
